intro: Miconia rhytidophylla, commonly known as the wrinkled-leaf miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with a distinctive wrinkled texture. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and is known for its rapid growth and ability to form dense thickets. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming invasive.
